etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of the Chemical Society. From acrid- + -one, after German Acridon

definitions: A crystalline heterocyclic compound which forms the basis of various biologically and pharmacologically active substances.

notes.text: Acridone is structurally similar to acridine, but has a carbonyl group opposite to the nitrogen in the central ring. Formula: C₁₃H₈NO.
